data.description:
Fellow UBC Economics Students! The Vancouver School of Economics Undergraduate Society is proud to present to you its first ever: ECON WEEK! 

To kick off the second term right, VSEUS has prepared a full week of fun events to promote the grand-opening of the Iona Building and showcase the opportunities we provide for Economic students at UBC. Come out and chill with the VSEUS Council for FREE EVENTS, FREE STUFF, and FREE FOOD. It is a week you do NOT want to miss! 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

January 11th - MAXIMIZE SURPLUS MONDAY

Join us for the grand opening of the Iona Building at our housewarming event with FREE TIM HORTONS DOUGHNUTS AND COFFEE to get you started for the day! We will also conduct tours throughout the day to give you the opportunity to look around and learn more about this wonderful building. 

LOCATION: Iona Building 
TIME: 9am-3pm
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

January 12th - MONOPOLY TUESDAY

Come over to the main lobby and write some housewarming messages or your goals for the upcoming year on our Iona Appreciation Board. We will also have a VESUS Wishlist Board to let you write on what you expect from US this term. We would love to hear your input!

Later in the night we will have a Monopoly board games night up in our new lounges! Bring all your friends and join us in this fun event! PRIZES will be given to winners. Food and refreshments will be provided.

LOCATION: Iona Building (Undergrad Lounge) 
TIME: 10am-3pm; 6pm-8pm
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

January 13th - OLIGOPOLY WEDNESDAY


Want to get involved and learn more about VSEUS and other Economics club? Then this is the day for you! Visit us at our clubs exhibition where we will showcase student involvement opportunities here in the Vancouver School of Economics. 

List of following organizations/clubs:
•	Vancouver School of Economics Undergraduate Society (VSEUS)
•	ECON Club
•	IONA Journal of Economics
•	ECON Cafe
•	International Economics Business Association (IEBA)

LOCATION: Iona Building 
TIME: 9am - 4pm 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

January 14th - MARGINAL BENEFIT THURSDAY

Thinking about applying to a graduate program? Prepare for the future and check out our informative Graduate School Information Session Night. With many presenters and falculty representatives, they will provide you with tips and techniques regarding applications and reference letters. Food and refreshments will be included. 

LOCATION: Irving K Barber Library (Dodson Room, Chapman Learning Commons) 
TIME: 6pm - 7:30pm

Event page:
https://www.facebook.com/events/665955986840708/
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

January 15th - OPPORTUNITY COST FRIDAY (19+)

Join us for a toast with the great company of your VSEUS Council and fellow classmates! We inivte you to come and have a couple of beers at The Wolf and Hound Irish Pub in celebration of a wonderful week. DRINKS WILL BE ON US! 

LOCATION: Wolf and Hound Irish Pub 
TIME: 7pm-10pm

Event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1503517166621954/
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
data.name: VSEUS Presents: ECON WEEK 2016

data.description:
Interested in learning about opportunities to work in the field of sustainability? There are more options than you think! 

The event will feature 6 different professionals whose work relates to social, environmental, and economic sustainability. You'll hear about their background and career path, as well as have a chance to network and talk with them one-on-one.

Our guest speakers include professionals from the public, private, and non-profit sectors, from early-career professionals to those who have been in their roles for a bit longer. 

- Viren Malik, COO at Ethical Bean Coffee
- Kyle Empringham, Public Engagement Specialist at David    
    Suzuki Foundation	
- Jeremy Moorhouse, Senior Analyst at Clean Energy Canada	
- Maggie Baynham, Sustainability Coordinator at City of Surrey	
- Joey Liu, Community Development Coordinator at The World    
    In A Garden
- Christopher Correia, Planning Analyst at Pacific Land Group

Refreshments will be provided.

This event was jointly organized by Common Energy (UBC) and Embark (SFU).
data.name: Sustainability Careers Night - Hosted by Embark SFU & Common Energy

data.description:
Euthanasia is a highly contentious issue and laws regarding voluntary and involuntary assisted suicide vary in different countries. Come join Friends of MSF in debating whether doctor-assisted suicide is justified. You will be split up into three teams, portraying an individual with their own perspective on the matter, including: a doctor, family member, and pro-life figure. After reading our case study with the rest of your team, you will present your opinion and will challenge other teams. Entry is free and refreshments will be provided.

Link to sign up for debate:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1HXFWXc6EvnPNFPokpntkqIdJB8_Dkk9_rKt5uRSKMIc/viewform
data.name: FoMSF Presents: Is Doctor-Assisted Suicide Justified?

owner.name: Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières UBC

Can't make it ( or can't wait!) to our LDC Welcome Back Party: RED Edition? Want to learn more about this term's classes? Have nothing to do and want free snacks and drinks? Like pre-parties? Come hang out with us before the party starts! 

Whether you are a past student or are interested in taking classes with us this term, this event is aimed at connecting/reconnecting you with fellow LDCers and executives!

place.name: AMS Student Nest, Lev Bukhman Theatre Lounge

data.description:
Our third annual Humanities & Social Sciences Conference hopes to inspire you as students to think beyond conventional boundaries. By participating in academic research, you are not only adding to the world of scholarly knowledge, you are also contributing to a canon of thought that will propel us into the future. At its root, research seeks to pull from a variety of diverse sources in order to create unique ideas. In doing so, students have the power to play an active part in shaping the world around us.

The focus of this year's conference is on INNOVATION. We are therefore seeking to highlight the important place of undergraduate thought in this evolutionary process.
Our conference aims to do this by providing a platform for students from all levels of undergraduate study to present their work, allowing them to enter into scholastic dialogue both with their peers, who are actively involved in this evolution, and with professors, who have previously been through this process themselves, and who are ensuring that it continues to take place in current students.

Attendance is free and includes complimentary lunch, refreshments, and prize raffle entry. Register at this link to attend: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/aus-humanities-social-sciences-conference-innovation-tickets-19670470908

CRITERIA FOR SUBMISSIONS:
We are accepting submissions as of NOVEMBER 16, 2015 - DECEMBER 16, 2015. 

We welcome submissions of presentation proposals from all universities and colleges in BC. Students may present work done as term papers, honours theses, or independent research projects; works in progress may also be eligible. Presentations should be no longer than 15 minutes, in English, and should represent work done while the presenter was an undergraduate student. The deadline for submissions is December 16th, 2015.

This year we have extended our submissions to include the work of Fine Arts students. Submissions can be 2D or 3D art pieces. Canvases may not be smaller than 12’ X 12” and no larger than 36” X 48”.

For more information: 
http://aus.arts.ubc.ca/events/conference/
OR send us an email on: 
aus.conference@gmail.com

#thisisyourhAUS #12000strong
data.name: The AUS Presents: The AUS Humanities & Social Sciences Conference

data.description:
Hello Arts students of UBC! Get ready, get pumped, and get some Arts pride!

The second term of the school year is approaching (already?!), and that means it is time for the Arts Undergraduate Society to present you its annual Arts Week!

❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖

WHAT IS ARTS WEEK?
Arts Week is a full week of events dedicated for creating Arts pride, community, and happiness! The events this week range from informative, healthful, and loads of fun! 

WHEN IS ARTS WEEK?
Arts Week takes place the second week after the Winter Break, from January 11 to 16!

WHAT ARE THE EVENTS?
—Monday, Jan 11—
❖Clubs In the Sub
❖Pancake Breakfast @9-11am in the Nest 
❖Trivia at The Pit @8pm

—Tuesday, Jan 12:—
❖Free Coffee & Hot Chocolate: Mural Unveiling @11-1pm in MASS
❖Wine and Cheese: http://on.fb.me/1S0iIUH 

—Wednesday, Jan 13—
❖Wellness Fair @12-3:30pm
❖Pop Up Ping Pong @11-1pm
❖Zumba class: http://on.fb.me/1Jq1uxk 

—Thursday, Jan 14—
❖Live Music & BBQ @11-2pm

—Friday, Jan 15—
❖Purple: Storm the Pit: http://on.fb.me/1MPIrHE
❖The Calendar + AUS FYC Present Garbagé: http://on.fb.me/1R7UnfJ

—Saturday, Jan 16—
❖AUS Humanities & Social Sciences Conference: http://on.fb.me/1PcfNlU


CONTESTS AND PRIZES?
We would love to see your AUSome pictures from Arts Week! For each event, we will be selecting one winner from Instagram to be awarded with 5 drink tickets for our Purple: Storm the Pit party! Use the hashtags #UBCArtsWeek2016 in your Arts Week post so you can be entered into our contest. Limit to one entry per event (the more events you attend, the higher your chance of winning!) 


❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖❖

We’re looking forward to seeing you all there at this week for YOU! #12000strong #thisisyourhAUS

data.description:
Welcome to the first UBC Slam Poetry writing workshop of the semester! The workshops last semester were a success and I am very excited to keep on writing and performing with you. UBC Slam will run biweekly writing workshops where we will do writing exercises, performance exercises, and stage technique. These workshops will be every other Tuesday.

We have booked a room in the Student Nest for the workshop! I will see you at 1pm in room 2528.

I am very excited for this workshop! If you have a piece you have been working on and want to workshop it, bring it with you and we will listen and give feedback!

Thank you,
Mariah Dear
604-318-6587

***UPDATE***
There will be free coffee at this workshop! Bring a mug to help out, but we will have a few paper cups available too!
data.name: UBC Slam Poetry: Writing Workshop #1 of 2016

data.description:
The Mentorship Program is the biggest and probably most important aspect of our club. First year CSP students who are members of our club have the unique and enriching opporutnity to be paired with an alumni CSP student as their mentor. A mentor would guide you through the process of discovering specialization options, summer school courses, volunteer opportunities, extracurricular activities, and many many more. 
________________________________________________

Mentorship Night is the perfect time and place to meet mentors and mingle with some alumni CSP students who have been through exactly what you are going through!

You can also purchase your $2 (only) club membership at this event!!! Members benefit from having an assigned mentor, free access to events hosted by our club and free food/stuff here and there. 

COME OUT AND HAVE SOME FUN WITH US!
- EAT FOOD
- PLAY GAMES & ACTIVITIES
- ASK QUESTIONS
- GET YOUR MEMBERSHIP
- MINGLE (before the first wave of midterms hit!)

Members and Non-members: FREE 
(Only this event will be free for everyone!)
_______________________________________________

STAY TUNED for fun facts about the mentors you will be meeting!

Questions: csp.mentorshipclub@gmail.com

data.description:
Are you interested in making a difference in someone’s life? Do you want to give back to society? Do you like FREE FOOD?
If so, come out and save lives by wearing green and DONATE BLOOD during Kin Week in the ballroom at Totem Park Residences from 11:00am to 2:00pm.

After you donate there will be a FREE BBQ at OSBORNE!!! Come and endulge in some burgers and hot dogs after you give back or if you can't donate just stop by for FREE FOOD.
BLEED GREEN!

*Appointments can be booked at blood.ca/donate or call 1-888-2-DONATE*
Spaces are filling up so book your time asap!
Drop-ins will also be welcome at the clinic, however space is limited and there is no guarantee that there will be a space available at your desired time.

data.description:
Join us on Saturday, February 27th for VSEUS's 3rd annual conference, where experts in various areas will be discussing today’s gender issues and how to change the face of leadership in the workplace.

Speakers include members of UBC's Vancouver School of Economics, Ernst & Young, Coast Capital Savings, Surrey Board of Trade and many more! After hearing their expert opinions, we will open the floor for discussion.

FREE lunch will be provided. This conference provides an excellent opportunity to debate the potential economic, work and social implications of gender in the workplace, so be sure to attend!

Business casual attire

Location: IONA 301

SCHEDULE

 9:00 am- Arrival and coffee (please arrive before 9:45)

10:00 am- Introduction to the conference 

10:10 am- Session 1: The Economics of Workplace Gender Issues

10:55 am - Coffee Break

11:00 am- Session 2: Experiences with Gender in the Workplace

12:30 pm - Lunch and Networking

13:30 pm - Session 3 : Changing the Face of Leadership

3:00 pm - Closing remarks

RSVP here: http://bit.ly/1PpWqIU

FEATURED PRESENTERS

Nicole Fortin - Professor @ UBC VSE

Lawrie Ferguson - Chief Marketing @ Coast Capital Savings

Michelle Grant - Senior VP, Transaction Advisory @ Ernst & Young

Ellen Bird - Exec. Director @ BC Women in Energy Network, 
VP @ Sea Breeze Power Corp

Barinder Rasode - Co-founder @ SheTalks, former City of Surrey Councillor

Jill Earthy - Board Member @ Women's Enterprise Centre

Anita Huberman - CEO @ Surrey Board of Trade

Tracy Theemes - Co-founder @ Sophia Financial Group

Paulina Cameron - Board of Directors Chair @ Young Women in Business

Emily Ohler - CEO & General counsel @ Broadleap Solutions Ltd., former Legal and program Officer @ UN Compensation Comission
data.name: VSEUS Presents: 3rd Annual Conference - Gender in the Workplace

data.description:
How do we shift from the ruthless exploitation of nature toward cooperation with it?

Faced by financial crisis, climate change, scarce resources and social injustice, we've reached a point where societies need to re-evaluate how to grow in a more sustainable manner. 

Join recognized author and activist Ralf Fücks as he discusses his new book that addresses some of these critical questions and discusses a new approach to economics, innovation and proactive policymaking that seeks to overcome the dangers posed by climate change.

Free. Registration required. Lunch provided.

Photo credit (shared under Attribution-ShareAlike 2.0 Generic):
Downtown Vancouver Sunset, Magnus Larsson  / Flickr
data.name: Smart Growth: From Exploitation to Cooperation with Nature

data.description:
Are you currently looking for a co-op work placement? Are you nervous about looking for your first work placement? 
Are you looking to polish your interview skills for a challenging interview?
Are you looking forward to having experienced co-op students give you advice on your cover letter or resume? 

Science Co-op Students Associations (SCOOPS) will be hosting a three-in-one package to help you! We will offer one on one  resume, cover letter and mock interview workshops for all those currently applying for science co-op jobs or are interested.

We will have SPECIFIC industry/job targeted questions to help you bring on your A game to the real interview. 

In addition, we will have FREE Linkedin headshots taken so that you can create/update an epic Linkedin profile for yourself!

**Refreshments will be provided. Availability is on first come first serve basis. **

DRESS CODE: Business casual

To get the most out of this workshop, please comment below on the type of co-op jobs that you are interested in applying for
so we can tailor our questions for you.

Looking forward to seeing you soon!
data.name: 3 in1 Workshop: Resume/CL, Interview + FREE Linkedin Headshots

data.description:
One year has passed by in the blink of an eye, and it is once again time for us to elect a new SSA Executive Committee! (If you are interested in applying for an exec position, don't forget to check out the details on how to apply at the bottom of this description.)

This will be the final event hosted by the current executive committee, and it has truly been our honour to serve you over the past year.

During this special event, we will be listening to the election speeches from our candidates and voting for next year's exec team. We would like to encourage you to exercise your right to vote and let us know where the club should be headed in the future. We believe that every member of the SSA is important to the club's success, and we welcome your opinions and decisions on which individuals you believe will help lead and improve the club in the following year. 

Don't miss out on this great opportunity to celebrate an awesome year together with the club at our final event! There will be free food (chicken rice!) served for members and wonderful company as usual.

DATE: Friday, March 11th, 6-9pm
LOCATION: The AMS Nest, Performance Theatre (known to some as The Egg)

Price: 
Members: FREE
Non-members: $8

Please RSVP and let us know if you are attending our event!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

INFORMATION FOR ELECTION CANDIDATES:

Please fill out this application form if you are interested in applying for a position on the executive committee: http://goo.gl/forms/PJw06S7KfX
**Applications are due by March 4th**

Check out the following PDF document for a more detailed description of each position's duties and requirements: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_mQx88dKNNkLWlrT1UteTBMTGs/view?usp=sharing

Stay tuned for updates!

data.description:
All UBC Human Resources Management Club members are invited to our Annual General Meeting!

Want to have a say in who runs the club next year? Come out for FREE PIZZA and VOTE for next year’s UBC HRMC President. An online polling link will be available for members who are not able to make it out to the event. 

Date: Wednesday, March 2nd
Time: 5:15pm - 6:00pm
Location: Room 332, Henry Angus Building
Who: All HRMC members

Interested in being President of the UBC Human Resources Management Club for the 2016/2017 academic year? 

You may apply as President or Co-President (if you are applying for Co-President, you must choose a partner and apply together). *** YOU DO NOT NEED TO BE A CURRENT MEMBER OF HRMC TO RUN TO BE PRESIDENT***

To apply, send Candice a statement of interest (300 words maximum for President, 500 words maximum for Co-Presidents) for the position to hrmc.communications@gmail.com before 11:59PM on Monday, February 29th. All candidates must prepare a speech (maximum 5 minutes in length) for voting.

Once a president has been elected, executive positions will be released.

Please direct any questions to hrmc.communications@gmail.com, or shoot us a message directly on Facebook.
data.name: ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING & HIRING | UBC Human Resources Management Club

data.description:
As you may know, BC has recently released the Climate Leadership Team recommendations for the province’s Climate Leadership Plan, and has just launched its public consultation on future climate action. This event will include free pizza!

This is indeed an important time for determining future climate action for BC, and the Pacific Institute for Climate Solutions (PICS) at UBC and Common Energy UBC want to help UBC students get informed and involved. As such, we are working together to host a panel session, comprised of three engaged and informed UBC faculty, students, Climate Leadership Team and/or Pembina Institute representatives, on the climate action options for the province. 

We’re aiming to have the session offer student’s a brief overview on the Climate Leadership Team recommendations, as well as other ideas, insight and action that can help position BC as a climate leader. We’d also like the discussion to encourage students to participate in the province’s consultation process.
data.name: Deciding BC’s Future Climate Action

place.name: Centre for Interactive Research on Sustainability

data.description:
JOIN UBC BLOOD FOR LIFE, UBC CMSSA, and UBC PERSIAN CLUB NEXT THURSDAY!

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ Short Description ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥
Stop by our booth to learn how to donate blood to patients (on campus), how to donate to research (also on campus!), how to become a potential stem cell donor and what it means to be a potential stem cell donor (takes only 5-10minutes and a cheek swab! but can make the difference in saving someone's life who is dying of a blood-related disease!) 

OR just stop by to say hi and grab some free cookies/ chocolates! 

We'll be boothing outside of the UBC Bookstore as well in the Buchanan Courtyard between 11 AM - 4:30 PM.

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ Long Description ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ 

Did you know that every 10 minutes, a person is diagnosed with leukemia? 

Did you also know that signing up to be a potential stem cell donor takes about the same amount of time? 

This is a great oppurtunity for you to learn more about stem cells and blood donations, and sign up to be a potential donor yourself to help save lives around you. If you’ve ever been interested in blood donation or becoming a part of the stem cell registry, or have any questions about the process or how to sign up, this is a great place to start. Our volunteers would love to talk to you more about any questions you may have.

Not interested in stem cell donations? Not to worry, we will also be holding a table to sign up for blood donations with Canadian Blood Services! You won't want to miss it!

"At any given time close to 1,000 Canadians are waiting for a stem cell match - and for a future full of hope." 
-- Canadian Blood Services

Check out some of these links for more information about
Stem cell donations:
https://www.blood.ca/en/stem-cell/donation-process#
https://www.blood.ca/en/stem-cell/myths-about-stem-cell-donation
https://www.blood.ca/en/stem-cell/what-happens-if-im-match

Blood Donations:
https://www.blood.ca/en/blood
https://www.blood.ca/en/blood/who-does-my-donation-help
https://www.blood.ca/en/blood/can-i-donate
data.name: UBC B4L & CMSSA & PERSIAN CLUB PRESENT: Grand Finale STEM CELL DRIVE

data.description:
Amnesty International UBC will be hosting its FREE annual conference on March 19th! Come join us to discuss a topical issue in human rights: human migration.

This year's conference will examine topics of human migration around the world, including conflict-induced migration from Syria, undocumented migration in North America, and refugee law and resettlement in Canada. 
___________________________________________________

Schedule:

11:30am – 12:00pm: Check-in and icebreaker!
12:00 – 12:30: Student Speaker
12:30 – 1:10: MOSAIC
1:10 – 1:50: Lunch
1:50 – 2:30: ISSofBC
2:30 – 2:40: Break
2:40 – 3:20: CARL (subject to change)
3:20 – 3:30: Break
3:30 – 4:00: Interactive workshop with the Social Justice Centre

Stay tuned as we will be updating this event page with additional information regarding this year's Speakers!
___________________________________________________

Event information: 

Where?      Allard Hall, Rm. 105
When?       March 19th: 11:30am (check-in) to 4:00pm
Free Snacks?    Yes! Sushi, pizza, and refreshments will be provided!

data.description:
If you are considering a career in law, come out for free pizza and bring all the questions you have about law school and about Allard School of Law!


We are very fortunate to have 6 Allard Student Ambassadors coming out to provide thorough and candid impressions as well as information about the Allard School of Law to applicants and admitted students, and information that could assist with the transition to law school.


The Student Ambassador Program is designed to assist prospective and admitted students in gathering the necessary information to make an informed decision about applying to or accepting an offer from the Allard School of Law. 


You might wonder:
• what’s law school really like: classes, professors, daily life?
• what career paths are in law
• what truly counts in the admissions process
• how to make your application stand out

This event requires a PSSA membership. If you do not have one we will be selling them at the door! Pizza will be limited so it is first come first serve, max two slices per student. We are keeping the limit on students at 40 so that there can be an effective Ambassador to Student ratio.


#ubcpssa
#allardschooloflaw

data.description:
Friends of MSF (Doctors Without Borders) will be hosting an MSF Awareness Week to draw attention to key MSF campaigns and global health issues. 

Come to each day to get free food and get entered into a raffle for a full free PIZZA!

Mon. March 21st @ Abdul Ladha (11-3 pm): A Fair Shot Campaign - http://www.afairshot.org/
Pneumonia causes the death of nearly 1 million children every year. Despite the availability of a vaccine to treat pneumonia, it costs 68x more to immunize a child now in 2016 than it did 15 years ago. Two pharmaceutical companies – Pfizer and GSK – are largely to blame for the significant increase in the cost of these vaccines. The goal of the ‘Fair Shot Campaign’ is to urge Pfizer and GSK to reduce the price of the pneumonia vaccine from $10 to $5. So come out and support the campaign by signing the petition!

Tue. March 22nd @ Abdul Ladha (10-4): Hospital bombings #NotATarget - http://www.msf.ca/NotATarget
We are hosting a Photobooth for the #NotATarget campaign in support of MSF. The campaign originated to stand in solidarity with civilians, patients, medical workers and hospitals who continue to be targeted victims of attacks by armed groups around the world; To highlight the horrific consequences of targeted attacks on people; and To demand the right of humanitarian workers to provide humanitarian care to people in need, particularly in conflict zones. Participants are also invited to sign a petition with us condemning such attacks.

Wed. March 23rd @ The Nest (10-4 pm): World Tuberculosis (TB) Day - https://msfaccess.org/TBmanifesto/
World TB Day strives to raise awareness about the severe lack of accessible treatment to TB in third-world countries as the rise of muti-drug resistant TB continues. Affecting more than 12 million people worldwide, it is essential for us to be aware of the need of proper distribution of TB treatment and diagnosis as TB becomes harder and harder to control and cure.

Thu. March 24th @ The Nest (9-6 pm): Malnutrition Tent - http://www.msf.ca/en/malnutrition
Poor nutrition causes nearly half (45%) of deaths in children under fiver (3.1 million per year). Want to learn how people get assessed for malnutrition in the field? Come and participate in our simulated assessment and learn about the signs of malnutrition. Thursday, 24th at the Nest from 9-6pm
data.name: FoMSF presents: MSF Awareness Week 2016

owner.name: Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières UBC

data.description:
This event qualifies for 25 IPE points!

For the coming Spring QuIPs conference on March 19, IHI UBC is excited to be working in collaboration with the BC Patient Safety & Quality Council to bring you the "Change Agent Workshop Series".

For students who have always wanted to learn how to step out of their comfort zone to become a leader, how do you make that transition from a participant to taking on a leadership role? As a leader, how can you lead differently to shift the mindset of leadership to effectively engage your team to harness individual collective energy? For those entering the professional workplace, what are the relevant skills you need in tackling the barriers you may encounter?

As the future leaders of tomorrow, let's start planting the necessary seeds to develop effective communication strategies and to build relationships that stress the importance of collaborative input in initiating change.

This will be an exciting and engaging opportunity for students interested in mobilizing to improve quality of care as well as learning the skills to become an effective change agent to do it. Free admission and lunch/refreshments will be provided.

Schedule of Events
9:00am-9:30am Registration
9:30am-9:35am Welcome from IHI UBC
9:35am-10:30am Towards Possibilities: Being an Organizational Change Agent
11:00-12:30pm The Glue that Holds It Together: The Importance of Community and Building Alliances
12:30pm-1:00pm Lunch Break
1:00pm-1:45pm Saddle Up!: Harnessing the Power of Resistance
1:45pm-2:45pm Keep the Fire Burning: Motivation and Maintaining Energy for Change

We're looking forward to seeing you at our Workshop Series this year.
data.name: Spring QuIP Change Agent Workshop Series

owner.name: Institute for Healthcare Improvement Open School: UBC Chapter

data.description:
Our first panel event of 2016 will be held on the evening of March 8th in PHRM 1101 (Pharmaceutical Sciences Building), centring on end-of-life care. We will be exploring end-of life care with an emphasis on how to minimize suffering for both the patient and the family, and how to ensure dignity is maintained.

We will feature four different talks: (1) navigating options in end-of-life care, (2) a family member’s perspective on end of life, (3) optimizing care to support both patients and their family caregivers, and (4) a primer on how to talk to patients about end of life.

Speakers include Dr. Jennifer Kryworuchko (Associate Professor, School of Nursing, UBC), Joyce Sandercock (Patient Voices Network ), Dr. Kelli Stajduhar (Professor, School of Nursing and Centre on Aging, UVic), and Dr. Pippa Hawley (Division Head of Palliative Care, UBC).

Students in professional health disciplines like audiology, dental hygiene, dietetics and pharmacy will receive 25 Exposure Level Interprofessional Education (IPE) points.

Refreshments will be provided.
data.name: A Pragmatic Approach to Respectful End-of-Life Care

owner.name: Institute for Healthcare Improvement Open School: UBC Chapter

Join us at old sub party room for the New Year Countdown Ceremony and a fun night!

This year, the magical Persian New Year festival of Norouz is coming to the heart of our campus at UBC!! We plan to countdown on March 19th, at the turn of the Persian New Year (that is 9:30:12 PM to put exactly!). We will celebrate the blossoming of spring  around a beautiful Haft-Seen table and the company of you beautiful people. So join us for a night filled with Persian music and dance, refreshments, finger food and pastries, Persian style tea and of course a warm environment to hang out with family and friends.

data.description:
The African Business Club presents its second social event this semester! Hosted by the Geopolitics and Finance Directors, this event aims to amalgamate issues concerning boarder security in western Africa and African business success stories. 

If you’re looking for a relaxed ease into a hectic week ahead, break from a long Monday or just a genuinely intriguing discussion and good company, this is the event for you! During the evening you’ll have the opportunity to watch specific handpicked videos, participate in thought-provoking discussions and engage first-hand with current issues of extreme global importance. Snacks and refreshments will also be available!

Let us entertain you on Monday evening! Looking forward to seeing you at the Global Lounge. 


Theme: Engaging with current geopolitical and financial issues in Africa. 

Two topics: 
	•	The issue of security in west Africa and its affect on cross-border relations
	•	African success stories and the role of financing 

Location:		 Global Lounge 
Date: 		Monday, 7 March 
Time: 			6pm 

AND FREE FOOD!!! :D
data.name: The African paradigm: Security issues and Success stories

data.description:
The Eating Sustainably  will showcase, educate and encourage students to support local food products that tie in the idea of sustainability. 

The Sustainability Ambassadors will host a hot-lunch provided by the finest UBC catering services (Westcadia, AMS Food Services, Agora and Sprouts) and other food products from a wide range of sponsors. The lunch will use ingredients that are grown or raised in an ecologically and ethically responsible manner, using practices that protect the environment, safeguard human health, ensure humane treatment of farm animals and provide fair treatment to workers. Funds raised from this event will be donated to the AMS food bank.

Cost: $2 (all proceeds will be donated the AMS Food Bank).

Enjoy an entrée, main course and desert at this interactive event where attendees will have to interact with at least one to two booths in order to obtain their food course!

Photo Credit: Martin Dee / UBC Communications & Marketing
data.name: Eating Sustainably for Wellbeing

data.description:
All students who vote will receive FREE BURGER at the Civil Club BBQ on March 18 at 11:00 am at the EDC Courtyard. Students must vote prior to getting free food. Voting is for the new Civil Club Executive and Professors of the Year!

Students on co-op don't need to worry as there will be online ballots avaliable which will be e-mailed. Civil merchandise will also be available for purchase during the event. We have shirts, toques, patches, stickers, sun glasses and pins!
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Want to get involved in the UBC Civil Engineering Club? Now is your chance! The Civil Club is looking for enthusiastic students who want to make a positive change in their community! Civil Club Elections 2016 are held in March with voting on March 18 when all civil undergrads vote to elect 6 executives and 9 ex-officio positions.


*Nominations Open - Friday, March 4 at 11:59 PM
*Nominations Close - Friday, March 11 at 4:00 PM
*Candidates Meetings (Optional) - March 11 - 4:00 PM
*Campaigning Starts - Friday, March 12 at 12:01 AM
*Voting Starts - Friday March 18 12:01 AM 
*Voting & Campaigning Close - Friday March 18 12:59 PM

Nomination forms will be made avaliable online when nominations open. Available positions are listed below with a brief description. Still got questions? Ask any of the current executives! You can also check out our website (http://ubccec.com/) or send the presidents an email at president@ubccec.com.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
EXECUTIVE POSITIONS:

**PRESIDENT**
The President is in charge of overseeing all club activities. They are in charge of being the liaison between the civil student body and the Engineering Undergraduate Society (EUS) and Civil Engineering Department.

**VICE-PRESIDENT**
The Vice President operates as second-in-command to the President. They are responsible for overseeing club activities and providing additional support to the President as needed.

**TREASURER**
The Club Treasurer is responsible for planning and preparing an annual budget for the club, as well as handling finances over the course of the year.

**SOCIAL COORDINATOR**
The Social Coordinator is responsible for leading the club's social events, with the goal of increasing interactions amongst civil students, students of other departments, and faculty members.

**SECRETARY**
The Secretary is responsible for taking and distributing meeting minutes from the weekly Civil Club meetings.

**PUBLICITY REPRESENTATIVE**
The Publicity Rep in charge of social media and publicity for all civil club events. Primary responsibilities include managing the facebook page, creating and distributing posters, and making class announcements. 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
EX-OFFICIO POSITIONS:

**ACADEMIC REPRESENTATIVE**
The Academic Rep is responsible for coordinating additional exam preparation tutorial sessions and communicating all students' academic concerns to the department.

**THIRD YEAR REPRESENTATIVE**
Responsible for conveying information between the 3rd Year class and the Civil Club. They share club updates with their class, and their class' questions, feelings, and suggestions with the club.

**GRAD REPRESENTATIVE(S)**
The Grad Rep(s) are responsible for conveying information between the 4th Year class and the Civil Club. They are also in charge of fundraising for grad events, play a role in planning the Iron Ring ceremony, dinner, and after-party at the end of the year, and organize the annual Grad Trip.

**SPORTS REPRESENTATIVE**
The Sports Rep is responsible for coordinating civil sports teams, including intramural and EUS-event sports teams.

**E-WEEK REPRESENTATIVE**
The E-Week Rep is responsible for overseeing civil involvement in all E-Week events, including promoting events to civil students, attending EUS-hosted E-Week prep meetings, coordinating participation and team involvement, and overseeing event attendence. E-Week preparations begin the first week of January, and E-Week is held in the first full week of February.

**DESIGN STUDIO & LOFT MANAGER**
The Design Studio and Loft Manager is in charge of taking care of the Design Studio and the Loft. They work for the general betterment of both spaces, including replacing, re-stocking, and managing services like the Design Studio printer and the Loft's vending machines.

**UNDERGROUND EDITOR**
The Underground Editor is in charge of creating and distributing our monthly department newsletter, the Civil Underground, which contains news, faculty and club updates, and details about upcoming events.

**WEBMASTER**
The Webmaster is in charge of updating and maintaining the club website.

**MERCHANDISE REPRESENTATIVE**
The Merchandise Rep is in charge of the ordering, marketing and sales of club paraphernalia, including jackets, hats, patches, pins and t-shirts.
data.name: Civil Club Elections & BBQ 2016

data.description:
You are cordially invited to join us on April 1, 2016 for an exciting evening of Art Historical discussion and critical reflection. The symposium comprises the presentation and discussion of a range of undergraduate research treating on contemporary and historical issues. This year's topics examine various art historical discourses, including: the amplification of brand value through imaging; the exploration of technophobia and transphobia assisted by advances in biotechnology, through the lens of the “The Cyborg Manifesto;” and, finally, the expression of national identity through the principle of “one in the all (wanwu guiyi)” that is firmly associated with history, society and Chinese culture. Each presentation will be followed by a conversation period during which all students and faculty are encouraged to voice questions and comments. Refreshments will be provided during intermission and final reception.
 
The Undergraduate Journal of Art History and Visual Culture (UJAH) will launch their 7th issue at the symposium. This publication features the exceptional body of research, art, and writing taking place in all undergraduate art disciplines at UBC, as well as the abstracts of this year’s symposium papers.
 
3:00PM – Introduction
 
Blake Finucane, #Branded: Christie’s in the Age of Digital Image Circulation
 
Ran Zheng, To Move The Mountain: The Image Of Collectivity In Chinese Contemporary Art
 
4:00-4:10PM – Intermission
 
Lucas Kling, The Cyborg Complex: Technophobia, Transphobia, and American Reflexxx 
 
5:00PM – Reception 
 
UBC Art History Students’ Association
Email: ubcahsa@gmail.com
Facebook: Facebook.com/UBCAHSA
www.ahva.ubc.ca
data.name: 12th Annual Art History Undergraduate Symposium & UJAH Issue 7 Launch

owner.name: UBC Art History, Visual Art and Theory

data.description:
UBC Club Mech would like to invite you to our Networking 101 Workshop. This is a free event for all UBC Engineering students. 

Date: Thursday, March 31st 2016 
Time: 6pm-8:30pm (sign in at 5:30)
Location: Engineering Student Centre (ESC) 
Max. Capacity: 200 
Food & beverages provided

We will be graced by the president of Vancouver’s Social Butterfly Club, Alice Zhou,  who will be giving a 2-hour presentation and interactive workshop on networking. Alice is an established event producer and publicist in Vancouver with over 6000 professional contacts in her network and is known as Vancouver's Networking Queen. 

Alice’s interactive workshop will cover the following networking topics:
 How to prepare before networking
 What to do during a networking event
 Tools of the trade
 When and how to best follow up with a networking contact
 Who should you network with?
 How to turn networking into getting a job or promotion

Bring/prepare a business card design (can be paper-printed design or an actual card), have a set-up LinkedIn profile, and dress in business casual/formal attire – as if you are actually attending a real networking event. 

RSVP HERE: http://goo.gl/forms/z6PCWSvvoQ 
RSVP LATEST BY WEDNESDAY, MARCH 30!

We hope to see you there!
data.name: Networking 101 Workshop

data.description:
Feeling lAUSt in Arts? Not sure what you're going to do with your BA? 
Fear no more! Let AUS be your compass! 

AUS FYC is excited to present "Beyond the BA", a career conference that will guide you, as a first year student, to your future. Bringing in Alumni from all major faculties, BtBA will take you on a journey of all the post BA possibilities.
BtBA hopes to inspire first years by presenting them with the opportunity to see how life is beyond the BA. Alumni from all ages will be speaking on their lives and jobs, and the opportunities that their UBC degree has given them post-graduation. This wide range of speakers will provide you with a timeline of how a Bachelors of Arts can assist you. 

---------------

For no cost at all, this conference will include:
- Complimentary lunch from Scent of a Sandwich 
- Refreshments
- Amazing networking opportunities!

---------------

REGISTER NOW FOR FREE! We have a limited amount of spots, so hop on them quick! Sign up here:
http://goo.gl/forms/zGShvfcJO9
---------------
Dress code: Business casual.
--------------
10:30 AM Registration 
-----------------
11:00 AM Opening Ceremony | Keynote
11:45 AM Session 1
12:15 PM Session 2 
-----------------
12:45 PM Lunch
-----------------
1:45 PM Session 3 
2:20 PM Session 4 
2:50 PM Keynotes | Closing Ceremony 
----------------
3:30 PM End
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


#getlAUSt #BeFound
#12000strong #thisisyourhAUS
data.name: The AUS FYC Presents: Beyond the BA Conference

data.description:
The African Business Club presents its third social event this semester! Hosted by the Infrastructure and Entrepreneurship Directors, this event’s objective is to spark discussion around Africa’s opportunity to leapfrog in diverse technological and entrepreneurial avenues: with innovations ranging from widespread mobile connectivity and clean energy to technology-enabled healthcare and education systems. The event will start with a TEDx talk by Mark Essien (Nigerian tech entrepreneur), which will serve as a foundation for discussion and debate.

This is a free event and a great chance to relax after a long  Monday with friends and some great company from the African Business Club team! If you are looking to have a great time with food, good company and an engaging discussion on topics of global importance, this event is for you!

 Let us entertain you on Monday evening! Looking forward to seeing you at the Global Lounge. 

Some of the topics to be discussed are founded on these questions : 

The West has thrived on the development of transformative technology, some of which have become older legacy systems: Should Africa bypass those legacy systems and instead use current technology and innovative techniques to leapfrog the West?
Should Africans take the lead on renewable energy? Why? Why not?

 Snacks and refreshments will also be available!

This event is free and open to everyone and also, 
FREE FOOD!
data.name: Reimagining Innovation in Africa: Leapfrogging the Rest of the World

data.description:
The very AMS that built the AMS Student Nest and hosts The 9th Annual AMS Block Party is hosting an open house to get you consulted, employed and on the winning end of some free block party tickets and/or gift cards! 
********************************************************************
1) TELL US WHAT YOU THINK 
In person - We're throwing our doors open for a literal open house this and welcoming students into the Nest for some focus groups on what to do with the former Perch space. Come by either session and be entered in a raffle to win two block party tickets! 

Open house dates/times: Saturday April 2nd from 3:45-5:30PM and Thursday April 7th from 11AM-3PM 

Online Survey - fill it out and win free things (~link coming at you real soon, check back tomorrow for more~)
********************************************************************
2) GET EMPLOYED
http://www.ams.ubc.ca/jobs/employment/ 
We're hiring for next year and all the jobs are posted at the link above - make sure you click the "more job descriptions" button to see all the options. Perks include year long pit guest list and lots of free coffee....
data.name: AMS Open House & Hiring

location.street: AMS of UBC Vancouver 6133 University Boulevard

data.description:
Do YOU like swimming? 
Want to meet some great people and get fit along the way?

Come out to the Inaugral 2016 UBC Swim Club Kick Off Event for more info! There will be information on our programs, free food, a post info social at the Pit, and a draw prize for a free 2016/2017 membership!

Check out our page for more info on our club and give it a good ol thumbs up!
https://www.facebook.com/swimclub.ubc/

Can't wait to see you there!

~UBC Swim Club Execs
